headline: Maria's Pepper Steak
description: This simple pepper steak recipe features a mixture of sliced flank steak and vegetables cooked in equal parts soy sauce, honey, and red wine vinegar.
name: Maria's Pepper Steak
recipeIngredient: 2 large bell peppers, sliced into thin strips
1.5 pounds flank steak, cut into thin strips

recipeInstructions.text: Heat oil in a large skillet over medium heat. Add bell peppers, onion, and garlic; sauté until crisp-tender, 3 to 4 minutes. Transfer to a bowl.

Increase the heat to medium-high and pour soy sauce, honey, and vinegar into the skillet. Add beef and cook, stirring frequently, for 10 to 15 minutes. Return cooked vegetables to the skillet and cook for 10 to 15 more minutes.

review.reviewBody: I think this is perfect, I wouldn’t change a thing!
This was a fantastic dinner!!! Very easy to make and my family loved it!!!!!
I didn't care for it. The red wine vinegar overtook everything
Very good recipe. I added 3 beef bullion cubes and the suggested cornstarch

I will use half the amount of red wine vinegar next time and probably try Worchester sauce, to have a bit less tang. I did use cornstarch to thicken up the sauce, and served over rice. Delicious!

Excellent recipe. Easy to make. I agree with E in marinating the steak in the soy and honey with cornstarch and rice vinegar. It is a quick way to velvet the meat and make it super tender. Most velveting calls for egg white too but it is not necessary. Meat does not dry out and is tender. I used bell pepper strips and sweet onion strips. Basmati rice. YUM!

THIS IS MY FAVORITE RECIPE! I make it all the time and it’s a win with my family when I go home to visit! This is what they always want me to make! The only thing I did differently was I seasoned the onions and peppers with black pepper (a lot of black pepper) and I also seasoned the flank steak with onion powder, garlic/parsley seasoning, and Zatarains creole seasoning and of course, a lot of black pepper. It comes out perfect every time! THANK YOU for this wonderful recipe!

This has got to be the EASIEST Peppered steak recipe I have tried. LOVE the sauce. Cooking with red meat has never been my cup of tea, it usually comes out "Chewey", you know when you have to chew a piece of meat longer than normal and eventually spit it out in a paper towel or just swallow it with a gulp of water. With this recipe I've tried it a few times with the Flank steak (great) but this last time I tried it with Ribeye (WARNING: little pricey..but worth it). I sliced it in thin strips, cooked the strips while still pink in the middle, then added it to the sauce for the last 10 min. OMG, SO TENDER, you almost didn't have to chew the meat... family absolutely loves it, (PICKEY EATERS meticulous husband and two boys 14 & 10). This one is DEFINITELY staying in my "do over" meal box. Thanks for allowing me to cook a red meat dish with no paper towel in hand or a gulp of water!
Very easy to prepare and is a very traditional pepper steak recipe. Loved it.
I added mushrooms and used mini sweet peppers instead and served it with sesame rice

As another reviewer noted, the steak needs to be cooked separately, and you can easily do it in the veggie pan, remove, and then warm everything together in the sauce. That would make this a 5 star for me. It is delicious, easy, and if you have leftovers, even better the second day.

it was okay. Nothing to write home about.

If my finicky husband liked it, it’s a winner. Changes, none except to triple the sauce because my husband requested more sauce for his rice. It’s a great pepper steak recipe.

Will make it again. The flank steak from our butcher was great.
Not the first time I cooked it, but the meat this time made it better.

This was so easy to make and it taste great. While mixing the ingredients I was unsure, since it just didn't sound right, and when it all came together it was like I ordered from the restaurant!
Phenomenal. I did use the tips posted in Rhiannon’s comment!
Loved it. I did substitute rice vinegar
I stuck to the recipe and the family loved it,will make it again

Excellent! We really enjoyed this. Took commenter E’s advice and marinated the steak with the soy sauce, garlic and a pinch of baking soda for 1/2 hour - worked like a charm! Thank you for this recipe, Maria. It is a keeper!

I garnished the plates with a sprig of basil and sliced it up over the dish as we consumed it. I also placed small dots of siracha around the outside of the plate to allow a little spice if desired. Was amazing! I will see if I can post the picture!

Used some leftover steak. Everything else followed as stated. Overall, very good, just a tad bit too sweet for what I think pepper steak should be. Would definitely make this again, just cut down on the amount of honey.

Very good and family really liked it! Will make it again, only may try some of the suggestions from other reviews to help make rhe steak a little more tender. Thanks!

this was pretty good, but needed to be takin up a notch... this is my opinion... i added shredded carrots and habanero peppers(diced) , i added red pepper flakes and one billion cube with ginger , curry powder and sesame seeds.. served over rice vermicelli...

Was not what I was expecting. Has little flavor. Needs a lot more seasonings. Very boring meal. It is a good start for something but I will not be making it again.

Yum!!! A few minor tweeks from reading reviews .. Definitely cook the meat separately in oil and not in sauce. Set meat aside while cooking sauce. Add veggies. Add the meat last to warm and serve. I used sirloin and it was SO tender! I doubled the recipe for my big family and tripled the sauce. I used 1 c. Rice wine vinegar, 1 c. Low sodium soy sauce and only 2/3 c. We had this for dinner last night! And there are some leftovers! It was good. I cooked it in a medium caldero and the meat came out tender. The sides were white rice, red beans, and fried plantains.
There were no leftovers at all. That is high praise from my people.

Oh my gosh, I made this tonight with just minor changes in the ingredients. Added pineapple and some juice, shrimp along with a piece of leftover steak and julienned carrots. I think my husband and I made a record on how fast we ate our dinner! Great recipe and thanks so much for sharing!!

Very tasty , I used skirt steak, instead, fast easy and great taste.

Easy, tasted wonderful- added broccoli to the peppers.
It`s so delicious. Most is depending on your choice of beef parts!
Made this for the family. They loved it just as the recipe called for. Will make this again on a regular basis.
I followed it exactly as is. It was great and I wont change anything not yet anyway.
Delicious!!
My family were not fans. It felt like it was missing something. I plan on trying again with my own spin...maybe chili flakes..something to boost the flavor profile.
I love this dinner! I make it all the time but in the slow cooker! I add everything but the peppers and cook in low for 5-6 hours. Then add the peppers until the preferred texture.

Recipe as is listed on the website is a 3 star recipe. If you want it to be a 5 star recipe, follow my advice and do this:

Once you have cooked the meat in the juices, and the meat has tenderized, mix up some corn starch (about 1 TB) and flour (1/4 cup) in about 2 cups of cold water, and then pour it into the pan with the meat. This will form into a delicious gravy that you can then use to pour over the rice. I didn't measure the Corn Starch or Flour when I was cooking, so the above amounts are only guestimates, however, you can easily adjust things according to how thick you want your gravy to be.

I personally added a few Jalapeno's in with the rest of the peppers to spice things up a bit,

Only things we decided to tweak was to put in less honey - it was a little too sweet with 1/3 cup, so we did about half that the second time and it was perfect, and to add flour to the sauce to make it a little thicker, after everything was done cooking. loved it! Cooked everything separately and then together for 15min and it all came out lovely. Sauce thickened too much so add a little water when reheating.

Mmmgood. Hubby & kids luv it.

Overall, excellent recipe, would cut honey in half next time. Awesome flavor. added about 1tsp red pepper flakes for some spice and 1tbs of corn starch at the end to thicken sauce. Also doubled the sauce.
